page.title: 02Oakham Castle
page.content:
Oakham Castle was originally built as a manor house in 1180, by Walkelin de Ferrers. By 1521 the castle was virtually a ruin with only the hall kept in repair. On Mondays it is used as a Magistrates Court. (by Emma Thompson)
Oakham Castle still stands today although some parts of it have fallen into disrepair. It is a custom that any noble person on his first visit to Oakham must leave a horse shoe to be put on display in the castle. They date from about 1492 to 1985. Oakham Castle is now used as a Law Court. (by Juliana Graham)
